Bima Dominate

{% endblock %} {% block archetype %}

Highlights

This is an allies bleed deck using {{ card("Bima") }} with {{ card("Dominate") }} to play a profusion of {{ card("Govern the Unaligned") }} and {{ card("Deflection") }}.

{{ card("Bima") }} gets no stealth but the sheer number of actions — and the fact that he has a strenght of 2 — makes it quickly difficult for the prey to block everything.

The deck has serious stealth, with most vampires having o, and even plays {{ card("Cloak the Gathering") }} and {{ card("Veil the Legions") }} that can beneficiate the {{ card("Bima") }}.

Most vampires of the crypt also have D and build a nice chain for {{ card("Govern the Unaligned") }}: {{ card("Halim Bey") }} can help get everyone out fast and cheap using the superior version.

Tips & Tricks

{{ card("Waters of Duat") }} make for additional minions with d since the {{ card("Dominate") }} card is available in such numbers.

{{ card("Conditioning") }} is used for the lunge and can even be used by {{ card("Bima") }} if they didn't use {{ card("Govern the Unaligned") }} beforehand.

The high number of {{ card("Deflection") }} and {{ card("Delaying Tactics") }} makes for a sturdy defence. Keeping a minion or two unlocked to play is critical.

Variants

The archetype is seldom played and not many variations exist. The number of {{ card("Bima") }} in respects to {{ card("Waters of Duat") }} can vary and {{ card("Perfectionist") }} can be included to help the Followers of Set get some blood back. {{ link("/deck-search", _("Ivor Blockley's deck"), twda_id="2k8sydneyqual") }} from 2008 is another example.
